snippet: The case exemplifies a glaring failure in the American-led nation-building effort here: weak government institutions are often staffed by unqualified officials.
abstract: Afghanistan's police officers have not been paid since November, and in some cases since October, because of Interior Ministry's failure to meet filing deadline with Finance Ministry; case exemplifies undermining of American-led nation-building effort by weak government institutions staffed by unqualified or incompetent individuals.

byline.original: By MATTHEW ROSENBERG and JAWAD SUKHANYAR
byline.contributor: Hares Kakar contributed reporting from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: The case exemplifies a glaring failure in the American-led nation-building effort here: weak government institutions are often staffed by unqualified officials.

headline.main: Afghan Police, Often Derided, Face Another Drawback: Missing Pay
headline.print_headline: Afghan Police, Often Derided, Face Another Drawback: Missing Pay
